page.title: 15HUTTON ESTATE - LANDSCAPE
page.content: Hutton-in-the-Forest is set in extensively landscaped grounds and woods. The Parkland is grazed, and contains clumps of trees. It is intended to plant a series of new clumps to replace those that are getting old. To the Southwest of the house is a rhododendron garden which has become derelict. With the help of the Countryside Commission, a programme of restoration has been instituted. Beyond this garden is an Eighteenth Century lake which has been obscured by scrub trees, and this is being opened up. Planting around much of the house is partly 18th Century hardwoods, and partly 19th Century conifers. It is planned to continue the practice of replanting with interesting trees when they come to the end of their life.
